block.p: Moira Anne Pascale, a daughter of Mary Ellen and Joseph Pascale of Madison, Conn., was married there yesterday to Keith Isaac Cotlier, a son of Lindesay P. B. Cotlier of Woodbridge, Conn., and Dr. Edward Cotlier of Manhattan. The Rev. Gerard G. Schmitz performed the ceremony at St. Margaret Roman Catholic Church.
The bride and bridegroom, both 27, graduated from Southern Connecticut State University.

Moira Anne Pascale, a daughter of Mary Ellen and Joseph Pascale of Madison, Conn., was married there yesterday to Keith Isaac Cotlier, a son of Lindesay P. B. Cotlier of Woodbridge, Conn., and Dr. Edward Cotlier of Manhattan. The Rev. Gerard G. Schmitz performed the ceremony at St. Margaret Roman Catholic Church.
The bride and bridegroom, both 27, graduated from Southern Connecticut State University.

Mrs. Cotlier is a writer and the special projects manager for Catalog Age, a trade magazine in Stamford, Conn. Her father is the senior engineer at General DataComm Industries, a maker of telecommunications equipment in Middlebury, Conn. Her mother is a founder and a director of Life Haven, a shelter for women and children in New Haven.

Mr. Cotlier is the systems analyst at Aliquant, a company in Bethany, Conn., that manages human resources data for other businesses. The bridegroom's mother works at Benesoft, a computer software company in Bethany, as a manager of employee data for other companies. His father is the consulting ophthalmologist at the New York State Institute for Basic Research in Developmental Disabilities in New Springville, Staten Island.
